entry.title: Salmon on Sea-Salt Bed
entry.content:
Yes yes yes. Fish is healthy. Even though I don’t like it as much as… chocolate for example, I try to eat it from time to time.
I find salmon really tasty and easy to cook, so here is my favorite recipe.

Ingredients

Salmon:
  • ~800 gr salmon fillet
  • 500 gr sea salt
  • pepper to taste
Side-dish:
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 bunch of asparagus
  • 2 tablespoons of olive oil
  • salt to taste

Steps

1. Spread the salt evenly in an oven tray.

2. Cut the salmon fillet in servable portions and then place the pieces in the tray with skin side down. Season the salmon with pepper. Bake it in the oven at around 220 degrees Celsius until it looks done. I usually test it with a fork. If it flakes easily under the pressure of the fork then it is done.

3. Wash and cut the asparagus.

4. Spread the olive oil evenly in a pan (I used a grill pan) and add the asparagus. Sprinkle the asparagus with salt and cook it 3-5 minutes on each side.

5. Serve immediately with the salmon. I added 2 fried eggs as a bonus. Because I deserve it.

Yes… I know. You feel like something is missing… The SAUCE, of course! That is why I added the fried eggs with a runny yolk…
I was too eager to eat the salmon and I skipped the sauce. However, if you have the patience to prepare a sauce, I recommend a hollandaise sauce with this dish.

Checkout the gallery below for guiding photos.

Have fun and poftă bună!
entry.summary:
Yes yes yes. Fish is healthy. Even though I don’t like it as much as… chocolate for example, I try to eat it from time to time.
I find salmon really tasty and easy to cook, so here is my favorite recipe.

entry.title: Dark Chocolate Mousse
entry.content:
Don’t you just love chocolate? I know I do!
Here is a recipe for a dark chocolate mousse, quick and easy to make, with a special ingredient. Check it out!

Ingredients

Mousse:
  • 100 gr dark chocolate (of your preference)
  • 100 gr butter
  • 200 ml heavy cream
  • 200 gr Greek yogurt (10% fat)
  • half a teaspoon of chilly powder (crazy right?)
Toppings:
  • raspberries
  • berries mix
  • strawberries

Steps

1. Add heavy cream to a mixing bowl and use a mixer to obtain whipped cream. Store it in the fridge until you reach Step 3.

2. Add the chocolate, butter and chilly powder into a bowl. Place the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water (the bottom of the bowl should not touch the water) and stir in occasionally. Keep the bowl over the saucepan until the butter and chocolate are melted and the mixture is homogenous, then set the bowl aside.

3. Add the Greek yoghurt and the whipped cream into a large bowl and mix them together.

4. Pour the melted chocolate and butter over the cream and mix them together with a spoon. Mix slowly with large movements such that you obtain an aerated cream.

5. Place the obtained cream in serving bowls or glasses and store in the fridge for at least one hour before serving.

6. Serve the mousse with fruit toppings of your choice.

Checkout the gallery below for guiding photos.

You might find it strange to use chilly powder in desserts. But actually it is used in a lot of chocolate-based recipes because chilly accentuates the flavour of the chocolate.

Have fun!
entry.summary:
Don’t you just love chocolate? I know I do!
Here is a recipe for a dark chocolate mousse, quick and easy to make, with a special ingredient. Check it out!

entry.title: Healthy Cheesecake
entry.content:
Are you in the mood for something tasty, yet something healthy?
Here is a recipe for a tasty cheesecake, quick and easy to make. Check it out!

Ingredients

Crust:
  • 150 gr cashew (optional: roasted and salted)
  • 150 gr dates
  • 100 gr melted butter
  • optional: salt to taste
Cream:
  • 300 gr cream cheese
  • 300 gr Greek yogurt (10% fat)
  • the juice of 1 lime
  • 1 tablespoon of honey
  • 1 tablespoon of vanilla extract
Toppings:
  • berries mix
  • strawberries and bananas
  • raspberries
  • optional: 1 tablespoon of chia seeds

Steps

Crust:

1. Add dates, cashews and salt (if cashews are not already salted) to a food processor and mix until you obtain the desired consistence.

2. Add the crust into the desired container.

3. Spread the melted butter over the crust.

4. Store the container in the freezer until you prepare the cream.

Cream:

5. Add all ingredients into a big bowl and use a spoon to incorporate until you obtain a homogenous cream.

6. Poor the cream over the crust and use spoon to spread it evenly.

Toppings:

7. Place the desired fruits over cream.

8. Optional: If you are using frozen fruits you may also sprinkle a tablespoon of chia seeds over to them (the chia seeds will absorb the extra water).

Store in the fridge and serve whenever you feel like it!

Checkout the gallery below for guiding photos.

Here you can find the original recipe.

Have fun!
entry.summary:
Are you in the mood for something tasty, yet something healthy?
Here is a recipe for a tasty cheesecake, quick and easy to make. Check it out!

entry.title: Internet Privacy
entry.content:
Information is power. Information about you, means power over you… more or less.
What do you actually know about Internet privacy? How do you protect your online privacy?

This is what I have learned until now.

1. Things about Cookies

Cookies are files that contain information about your visit on a specific site. The information is saved on your local machine and then it is sent back to the website when you access it again. First-party cookies are used ‘internally’ to the site. However many sites will allow for third-party cookies which are created by other parties in order to provide information to advertising networks.
Third-party cookies can be blocked with ad-blockers. However, there are other little-tracking-monsters which are more difficult to avoid: like flash cookies and fingerprinting techniques. Google it if you want to find out more.

2. HTTP protocol

If you are interacting with a website which is using HTTP protocol… all the data that you are exchanging can be monitored (it is not encrypted in any way).
HTTPS encrypts information… so be sure that next time you check for that HTTPS before entering any personal information on a website.

3. Social media privacy

Maybe it’s time to check again the privacy settings on your LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter, etc., accounts. Do you want your profile to be accessible to everyone or just to your actual and well-known connections?

4. End-to-end encryption for messaging apps

Even though your messages are encrypted when they are sent over the Internet, apps like Messenger and Telegram decrypt the messages upon receiving them and they store the decrypted information on the servers. This is called encryption in transit. You will have to use the secret chat option in order to have those messages stored encrypted (end-to-end encryption).
WhatsApp uses end-to-end encryption and thus no one else can actually read your conversations, not even de the service provider.

If you have other useful information and want to share, fell free to leave it the comment section.
entry.summary:
Information is power. Information about you, means power over you… more or less.
What do you actually know about Internet privacy? How do you protect your online privacy?

This is what I have learned until now.

entry.title: Kitchen "redo"
entry.content:
Hello there my loyal readers (me, myself and I).

This evening I want to share with you one of my DIY projects: painting the kitchen tiles. Yup, you read that right.
There was no way I could change the tiles in my kitchen (too messy, to pricey and the cabinets were already set in place).
So I bought some (special tile) paint and I started playing with the paint-brush.

I do not have before and after photos, however I do have during and after photos.

Here is a random similar project video (English):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rTRWdIVQ-bU

And here is a how-to video for those of you who want to find out more (Romanian):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_5lOzduTvsk

If you have any questions, leave them in the comment section!
entry.summary:

So I bought some (special tile) paint and I started playing with the paint-brush.

entry.title: Introduction
entry.content:
Hey there!

I will use this website to share any interesting ideas that pop into my mind and any experiences that might be useful for the readers (whoever they might be).

I will try to keep it as short as possible.

I will also add random photos in random places and random parrot-party thingies (until I get bored).

Let the journey begin.
